DOC.brief_summary: The goal study determine acupuncture improve multiple symptom associate chemotherapy MD Anderson Symptom Inventory ( MDASI ) : nausea , vomit , fatigue , anxiety , anorexia , pain , disturbed sleep , shortness breath , dry mouth , depression , peripheral neuropathy ( see statistical section ) . The investigator hypothesis acupuncture result lower MDASI score course chemotherapy acupuncture group vs. control group .
DOC.brief_title: The Efficacy Acupuncture Treating Chemotherapy Side Effects Breast Cancer Patients
DOC.criteria: 18 year old English speaking/reading/writing Breast cancer stage I III Any performance status suitable chemotherapy determine physician Primary secondary chemotherapy , enrol patient prior chemotherapy regimen regardless previous radiation therapy exposure and/or previous mastectomy . Scheduled receive either follow two regimen : Adriamycin ( 60 mg/m2 ) , Cytoxan ( 600 mg/m2 ) , Taxol ( 175 mg/m2 ) Adriamycin ( 60 mg/m2 ) , Cytoxan ( 600 mg/m2 ) , Taxol ( 80 g/m2 ) Taxotere ( 75mg/m2 ) , Cytoxan ( 600 mg/m2 ) Taxotere ( 75 mg/m2 ) , Carboplatin ( AUC 6 ) , Perjeta ( 840 mg load fix dose , follow 420 mg maintenance fix dose ) History narcolepsy Sleep apnea require continuous positive airway pressure ( CPAP ) Other acupuncture treatment within one month enrollment Acupuncture treatment chemotherapy past Current participation research study
